intro: Erythroxylum gracile, commonly known as the slender copal tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Erythroxylaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, Colombia, and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and produces yellowish-green flowers that develop into spherical, woody fruits. Its botanical significance lies in its role within local ecosystems and its potential for ecological and medicinal research. The species is also of interest due to its close relation to other Erythroxylum species, some of which are economically important.
